alert.note: Alert for Adair; Boyle; Casey; Cumberland; Green; Marion; Metcalfe; Taylor (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 3:09PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Green, southeastern Marion, Taylor, southwestern Boyle, north central Cumberland, western Casey, Adair and central Metcalfe Counties through 345 PM EST/245 PM CST/... At 309 PM EST/209 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lebanon to near Campbellsville to near Edmonton. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Campbellsville and Lebanon around 315 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Columbia and Liberty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST/700 PM CST/ for south central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Boyle; Casey; Cumberland; Green; Marion; Metcalfe; Taylor
